messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 509
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/3/2002 1:06:26 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yes, a worm. While dissecting a work in the third grade MIGHT have been traumatic, it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/3/2002 1:06:26 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> << He never told us until recently that they
> dissected a work in the second grade. This is my early ethical vegetarian
> son
> who wouldn't eat Skittles. >>
>
> A worm, right?
>
> First I thought an essay, a poem, a play by Marlowe... (English lit
> classes
> rose up monentarily to haunt me!)
>
>

Yes, a worm. While dissecting a work in the third grade MIGHT have been
traumatic, it probably wouldn't have been on vegetarian grounds.

I got free AOL for a while volunteering on the Homework Help area, in the
English section. I was often amazed by the STUPID assignments the kids would
get.Many involved dissecting works that were perfectly fine without being
dissected, thank you.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
